item.title: Ongoing household waste in black bin bags / dumping of unwanted furniture., 24th September
item.description:
Location by tree / corner of the street has previously been used as a collection point in the absence of council bins. Despite bins now being provided residents are still leaving whatever they like on the corner of the street making it look like a slum.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oldhill Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 105 Newington Butts SE1 6SF, 24th September
item.description:
Dear Madam/Sir, As local police. we patrolled days and night on regular basis in St Mary Churchyard Park. I notice the lack of adequate public street lighting covering the park. Yesterday, as a colleague and I were visiting the nearby Castle Leisure Centre, the manager raised concerns of public safety about the clients/ public users/visitors in the night period where the park is poorly lit and in the darkness. Many Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchyard Row, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence leaning into pavement, 24th September
item.description:
A wire fence is leaning in significantly to the pavement which is used by a lot of parents and pupils for the nearby schools. Iâ€™ve already seen two people either catch clothing or their head on the top of the metal fence and it is becoming dangerous. It needs to be moved back
